title: Wilson stunner snatches last-gasp victory for Fulham to punish Brighton
description: Harry Wilson snatched an injury-time winner for Fulham with an inspired free-kick in their 2-1 comeback victory against Brighton
content: Harry Wilson’s taste for the spectacular continues to decorate Fulham’s season. In added time, the Welshman’s free-kick whipped towards Bart Verbruggen, whose failure to keep the ball out completed a regrettable afternoon for goalkeepers. Fulham had ... [4041 chars]

title: Manchester City get back on track against Wolves despite VAR handball rarity
description: Omar Marmoush and Antoine Semenyo scored the goals as Manchester City ended their Premier League wobble with a 2-0 win over Wolves
content: Manchester City have a first Premier League win in four games and Wolves a first defeat after going five unbeaten in all competitions after a fixture in which the referee, Farai Hallam, on his top-flight debut, dared to stick with his decision not to... [3829 chars]

title: Farai Hallam makes 'brave' call to deny Man City penalty against Wolves
description: Referee Farai Hallam was praised for choosing not to award Manchester City a penalty against Wolves on his Premier League debut.
content:
Making your Premier League debut at Manchester City would be a daunting prospect for anyone - even as a referee.
But 32-year-old Farai Hallam, once a professional footballer on Stevenage's books, earned widespread praise for his performance during Ci... [2779 chars]

title: Heavy snow and ice to impact millions as winter storm sweeps across US
description: Much of the south, central and eastern United States will see extremely icy conditions and heavy snowfall, disrupting travel from Arizona to Maine.
content:
US weather service warns of 'life-threatening cold air'
Sarah Keith-Lucas
Weather presenter

title: England vs Sri Lanka: Harry Brook calls Colombo pitch for second ODI 'probably the worst' he's played on
description: England captain Harry Brook says the pitch used for the second one-day international against Sri Lanka in Colombo was "probably the worst" he's played on.
content:
England captain Harry Brook criticised the pitch used for the second one-day international against Sri Lanka in Colombo, calling it "probably the worst" he had ever played on.
